definitions.title: n.m.
definitions.body: :Pr 12:13 prop. a bait or lure in a fowler's net; then fig. snare—abs. [[מוֹקֵשׁ]] Ex 10:7 + 15 t.; cstr. Pr 18:7, Pr 20:25; pl. [[מוֹקְשִׁים]] Ps 64:6, Job 40:24; [[מׂקְשִׁים]] Ps 140:6; cstr. [[מוֹקְשֵי]] Ps 18:6 + 3 t.; [[מׂקְשֵׁי]] 2Sa 22:6; f. [[מׂקְשׁוֹת]] Ps 141:9; bait or lure, in a net for birds Am 3:5; will not pierce nostril of hippopotamus Job 40:24; elsewhere fig. of what allures and entraps any one to disaster or ruin; Moses a snare to Egyptians Ex 10:7 (J); [[מוֹקְשֵׁי עָם]] Job 34:30, of men who are the ruin of their people; idols and idol-worship a pernicious lure to Israel Ex 23:33 (JE), De 7:16, Ju Jdg 2:3, Jdg 8:27, Ps 106:36; so alliances with Canaanites Ex 34:12 (JE), Jos 23:13 (D); Michal, to David 1Sa 18:21; of ´[[י]] as cause of ruin to evildoers Is 8:14; of plots of wicked Ps 64:6, Ps 140:6 (vb. [[שִׁית]]; ‖[[פַּח]], [[חֲבָלִים]], [[רֶשֶׁת]]), Ps 141:9 (‖[[פַּח]]); a lure or snare for wicked in their transgressions Pr 29:6, Ps 69:23 (‖[[פַּח]]); consisting in transgressions of lips Pr 12:13, cf. Pr 18:7, Pr 20:25; in wrathfulness Pr 22:25; in fear of man Pr 29:25; [[מָוֶת]] ´[[מ]] Ps 18:6 = 2Sa 22:6 (‖[[חֶבְלֵי שְׁאוֹל]]), Pr 13:14, Pr 14:27.
